Objective.evidence: This study examines the relationship between adjusted donor lung weight, a surrogate for extravascular lung water, and outcomes following bilateral lung transplantation.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes assessed were the incidence of PGD (grades II and III) and duration of intensive care unit (ICU) stay.

Number_Analysed.evidence: We retrospectively analyzed 194 bilateral lung transplantations performed between January 2014 and May 2021.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The incidence of PGD was significantly higher in the upper 4th quartile group ("high-weight," 22.9%) compared with the three lower quartile groups ("low-weight," 8.9%) ( p = .020).
